replies.body: So far I like what I see, but just throwing it out there since Sieging has become an acceptable meta in a lot of cases perhaps for marksmen subclass "Siege" would be added applicable to champions like Tristana and Sivir
But what would the other categories be?

There are definitely a few different flavours of marksmen. In a addition to the siege style i'd say there biggest difference is marksman who benefit from long drawn out teamfights like Jinx and Kalista, vs marksmen who do better in short burst skirmishes like Graves or Jihn

Jinx would fall under Hypercarry and as strong as her Rend damage CAN be, i feel Kalista would be more suited as something like 'Utility' because of what she can do with her ult, her ghosts and the slow from rend

I agree with this idea. There are a lot of ADCs that have abilities almost purely focused on helping them do damage, such as {{champion:222}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:81}} . Alternatively, we see some champions, such as {{champion:15}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:18}} and possibly even {{champion:110}}  who can serve a far more utility based role in matches.

I know that in my experience I see a distinct difference between the two sets and will naturally lean toward the latter. Due to the nature of their abilities they are still useful late game even after a bad start as opposed to the first set who are hypercarries and therefore suffer due to a lack of damage.

I think some sort of separation between hypercarry and utility focused champions would be something I would personally lean toward when dividing marksmen.

I like the changes, however i don't think it'll impact on high end play that much, however it is very beneficial for newer/casual players who don't know the ins and outs of all champs, this system does allow for the to make more appropriate champ choices to synergize with team setups. Top- tanky type/fighter or a hard counter class to it 
mid- AP / assassin

jungle...

AD mellee offensive focused champion = (Physical dmg) Fighter 

AP focused offensive champion = (Magic dmg) Wizard 

Mixed ADorAS/AP champion = (Hybrid dmg) Battle Caster 

Ranged auto dmg output based champion (AD or AP or Hybrid) = Marksman

High health/Dmg reduction , offensive based champion = Tank

High mobility,stealth ,clones,traps based champion = Assassin

AP focused defensive based champion = Enchanter

High health/Dmg reduction , defensive based champion = Warden 


Subclasses: 

Hand to hand and low range abilities based champion = Mellee

Ranged autoattack low to medium range baed champion = Shooter

High ranged magic dmg based champion = Artillery

High instant unavoidable dmg (AD or AP) based champion = Burst


there you have it!!! simple and direct
